DOC.brief_summary: The objective study evaluate clinical equivalence safety Test formulation diclofenac sodium topical gel 1 % ( Anchen Pharmaceuticals , Inc. ) compare market formulation Voltaren® Gel ( diclofenac sodium topical gel ) 1 % ( Novartis ) patient osteoarthritis knee . The efficacy Test Reference formulation also compare Placebo gel determine Superiority .
DOC.brief_title: Evaluation Clinical Endpoints Two Diclofenac Sodium Gel 1 %
DOC.criteria: 1 . Ambulatory Male Non Pregnant Females 35 year old diagnose osteoarthritis ( accord American College Rheumatology Criteria ) one knee . ACR Criteria include , Knee Pain least 3 follow : 1. age ≥ 50 2. stiffness last < 30 min 3. bony tenderness 4. crepitus 5. bony enlargement 6. palpable warmth 2 . Symptom onset > 6 Months prior Screening target knee . 3 . If female childbearing potential , prepare abstain sexual intercourse use reliable method contraception study ( e.g. , condom + spermicide , IUD , oral , transdermal , injected implant hormonal contraceptive ) . 4 . Periarticular knee pain due osteoarthritis ( bursitis , tendonitis etc ) require use oral topical treatment ( NSAIDS acetaminophen ) > 15 day 30 day prior Screening . 5 . Radiograph target knee within previous year Grade 1 , 2 3 disease base upon KellgrenLawrence disease severity scale . 6 . After 7 day wash pain medication baseline pain movement score ≥ 50mm 100mm Visual Analogue Scale target knee . 7 . After 7 day wash pain medication baseline WOMAC pain sub scale ≥ 9 5 question , 5 point ( 0 4 ) Likert scale target knee . 8 . Willing able use acetaminophen rescue medication 9 . Willing able comply study requirement . 1 . Females pregnant , breast feeding , plan pregnancy 2 . Radiograph target knee within previous year Grade 4 score KellgrenLawrence disease severity scale . 24 3 . History osteoarthritis contralateral knee require medication ( OTC prescription ) within 12 month screen . 4 . After 7 day wash pain medication baseline pain movement score ≥ 20mm 100mm Visual Analogue Scale contralateral knee immediately prior randomization . 5 . Known history secondary osteoarthritis ( e.g . congenital , traumatic , gouty arthritis ) rheumatoid arthritis . 6 . Known history chronic inflammatory disease , ( e.g. , colitis ) fibromyalgia . 7 . History asthma , hypertension , myocardial infarction , thrombotic event , stroke , congestive heart failure , impaired renal function liver disease . 8 . History coronary artery bypass graft within 6 month screen . 9 . Concomitant acetylsalicylic acid therapy stable low dose use cardiac prophylaxis ( max 162mg daily ) take least 3 month prior enrollment maintain throughout duration study . 10 . Use warfarin anticoagulant therapy within 30 day screen . 11 . Use ACE inhibitor , cyclosporine , diuretic , lithium methotrexate , within 30 day screen study . 12 . Known history gastrointestinal bleeding peptic ulcer disease . 13 . Abnormal screen clinical laboratory evaluation Investigator determines clinically significant . 14 . Known allergy aspirin NSAIDs . 15 . Results liver function test two time upper limit normal range screening . 16 . Any acute chronic illness opinion investigator could compromise integrity study data place Patient risk participate study . 17 . Concomitant use corticosteroid ( formulation ) use within 30 day study randomization . 18 . Receipt drug part research study within 30 day prior screen . 19 . Previous participation study .
